intro: Chrysanthemum croaticum, commonly known as the Croatian chrysanthemum, is a herbaceous perennial native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, displaying a range of colors from yellow to deep orange. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable ornamental plant in gardens.
